p: Dr Li Wenliang was later infected by SARS-CoV-2 from an asymptomatic glaucoma patient i and died on February 7, 2020, at the age of 33. Ironically, it was an ophthalmologist who alerted officials, though complications of the eye are not considered key symptoms of COVID-19. Here, we assess how the eye is affected in COVID-19 and discuss corresponding infection control measures. We also highlight the role of ophthalmologists â€“ although less involved in saving lives like other key specialists, they may be the first to see and diagnose new emerging diseases.
